description: Commands to manage notification hub namespace.

commands.name: az notification-hub namespace check-availability
commands.summary: Checks the availability of the given service namespace across all Azure subscriptions. This is useful because the domain name is created based on the service namespace name.

commands.name: az notification-hub namespace create
commands.summary: Create a service namespace. Once created, this namespace's resource manifest is immutable. This operation is idempotent.
commands.syntax:
az notification-hub namespace create --name
                                     --resource-group
                                     --sku {Basic, Free, Standard}
                                     [--location]
                                     [--tags]
examples: az notification-hub namespace create --resource-group MyResourceGroup --name my-namespace --location "South Central US" --sku Standard

commands.name: az notification-hub namespace delete
commands.summary: Delete an existing namespace. This operation also removes all associated notificationHubs under the namespace.
commands.syntax:
az notification-hub namespace delete [--ids]
                                     [--name]
                                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--resource-group]
                                     [--subscription]
                                     [--yes]
examples: az notification-hub namespace delete --resource-group MyResourceGroup --name my-namespace

commands.name: az notification-hub namespace show
commands.summary: Return the description for the specified namespace.
examples: az notification-hub namespace show --resource-group MyResourceGroup --name  my-namespace

commands.name: az notification-hub namespace update
commands.summary: Update a service namespace. The namespace's resource manifest is immutable and cannot be modified.
commands.syntax:
az notification-hub namespace update [--add]
                                     [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--ids]
                                     [--location]
                                     [--name]
                                     [--remove]
                                     [--resource-group]
                                     [--set]
                                     [--sku {Basic, Free, Standard}]
                                     [--subscription]
                                     [--tags]
examples: az notification-hub namespace update --resource-group MyResourceGroup --name my-namespace --sku Standard

commands.name: az notification-hub namespace wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
